title: New SRAM Force 10-30 cassette splits the difference for finely tuned gear steps
content:
The new SRAM Force 10-30 cassette brings a wide-ish range gearing option to their 2nd tier road group. It slots in between the original 10-26, 10-28, and 10-33 cassettes, and the more recent 10-36 cassette that requires a different rear derailleur. Fortunately, this one falls well within the capabilities of the original AXS rear derailleurs [â€¦]

The post New SRAM Force 10-30 cassette splits the difference for finely tuned gear steps appeared first on Bikerumor.
author: Tyler Benedict
